page.title: 11Recreation in S.E. Guildford
page.content:
Golf is a popular pastime in Guildford. The club house at Merrow was built in 1886 and the course was designed by James Braid. Before the wars the course covered the whole of Merrow Downs. During wartime a prison camp was built which meant that some of the holes were moved. Lord Onslow donated land to the club of which he is President.
Eleven people are needed to maintain the course and the holes vary greatly in length. The club is popular, with 600 members ranging from 12 to 70 years, although it is quite expensive.
Other forms of recreation in the area include tennis, badminton, bridge, flower clubs, art classes, dancing, Girl Guides, Boy Scouts and riding.
